website_summaries.verdict: The Samsung Chromebook Pro will make a believer out of many Chromebook skeptics by offering great value, features and performance for a budget-priced laptop.
pros: A very long list of features for the price, including a QHD touch display, hybrid hinge and included stylus
Adding support for the Google Play app store means this Chromebook can access a wide range of software
cons: The keyboard and touchpad both remind you this is a budget laptop, and the accelerometer is way too touchy
Running too many apps and browser windows at once eats up the RAM quickly, leading to slowdown

customer_reviews.title: DON'T DO IT.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. I rareeeeely write reviews. RARELY, but I want to save other's the pain and hassle. This device (and its brother the plus) has a grave hardware flaw that causes the touchscreen to move on its own. A 'phantom touch' issue, where the screen resizes and tabs switch constantly as though a ghost is swiping your screen. I got a replacement unit and it had the SAME issue. Samsung has not been helpful in getting this fixed. It makes the ENTIRE device unusable. Ridiculous for something so expensive, some internet research shows numerous people having this issue. Meaning it's not isolated. Save yourself the trouble. Get a non-Samsung Chromebook. It's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: The touch screen has design/manufacturing flaw and many people confirmed it
customer_reviews.text: don't buy it. plenty of buyer returned it since the touch screen has phantom touch problems right after unboxing or it will eventually happen within 3 months. DO NOT BUY IT like me, a samsung fan. I will definitely read more comments before next shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Meng-chiu Lee

customer_reviews.title: First time Chromebook user and I am hooked!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little laptop!! Haven't seen any issues with it that some reviews/comments have reported. Having the ability to run android apps is amazing. This can definitely replace a laptop. If I need any windows programs I can use chrome remote desktop app and just remote into my home desktop. Yes, the black finish shows fingerprints really bad but that's easy to clean and it looks stunning. The screen is beautiful and really love the aspect ratio as I was initially afraid of that. I highly suggest this chromebook!
customer_reviews.author: C. Huff

customer_reviews.title: Coders Dream
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations in every way. Chromebooks have a bright future and Microsoft should be nervous. I bought the unit with the intention of exploring Chrome OS and trying to use the device as a development system for writing code. I installed Crouton Ubuntu in less than an hour and now I have a full Linux box to develop on for less than $600
customer_reviews.author: Emil M.

customer_reviews.title: The first chromebook that really hits every note right
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Chromebooks since the original CR-48. This is the first one I think that is really fulfilling what a Chromebook could truly be. While ongoing software updates will continue to improve the interaction with android apps, their availability at all is a fantastic addition to ChromeOS. A tablet mode gives further opportunities for interaction. I particularly have been enjoying using that mode to read comics and graphic novels. The stylus provides the capacity to sign pdfs properly, to take notes well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I love Chromebooks. I have three. This was great until it stopped working, for no reason, and I sent it to Samsung for repair. They said it was repaired and had been checked. I excitedly tried to use it and the same exact problem was present. Do not buy Samsung Chromebooks. Screw them.
customer_reviews.author: Jkw RN

customer_reviews.title: Best Chromebook in 2017
customer_reviews.text: Awesome chromebook. Very thin, light, and runs fast. I love that it charges with USB-C, just like a phone charger; way better than the old clunky laptop chargers. This one is great for running crouton or dual boot to linux. Then you can use it for a nice portable programming / developer laptop. Pro has an Intel processor which runs linux well, unlike the Plus or other chromebooks with ARM processors.
customer_reviews.author: Corey B

customer_reviews.title: the touchscreen will fail
customer_reviews.text: The screen is outstanding. I like most every feature on the device. But here i am a few months after spending triple the price of my last chrome book that lasted multiple years and the touch screen will no longer recognize touches by fingertip. Stylus only. Even after powerwashing the device to factory (the new version of ""turn it off and on again") the screen still doesnt recognize hand touch input. Ill likely get a different chromebook. It sure as hell wont be a samsung.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hazen

customer_reviews.title: Decent if you are okay with never getting linux apps.
customer_reviews.text: Good all around chrome book. The screen is clear and sharp and the pen functions well for notes and limited art. Performance is good for a chrome book and does very well running android apps. The tablet mode is neat and in my opinion isnt too heavy for tablet use. My biggest gripe is that it will never be able to officially support linux apps, which was in small part a reason why i bought this. Due to a kernel limitation this chromebook will never see linux apps, but ironically its lesser brother the samsung chromebook plus already has linux apps.
customer_reviews.author: Insert name here.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Streamline
customer_reviews.text: Simple. Efficient. Acts just like my Samsung Galaxy on many levels. And since I keep a Google account I can wipe this whenever it seems to get bogged down and Google has my stock info and chrome info so reboots take 15min to be back to normal instead of hours. Smart! Only criticism is how file management works. Definitely pushes you to keep files on Drive instead of this device. Not a big problem but I find the Google store a bit untrustworthy with organizational programs from non-google developers. Where's the accountability?
customer_reviews.author: jmitch

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love It! Best Chromebook Available!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this laptop, got one for my mom and my step dad. They both enjoy it. Works really well, doesn't lag or slow down. Super easy to set up and maintain (especially from an IT support perspective). This is now my go-to recommendation for all family members and friends. Stylus is really fun to use too. My aunt has the Samsung Chromebook Plus and I wasn't overly impressed with it. You can have many more tabs open without problem on the Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bass

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend any day.
customer_reviews.text: I love this computer. I went from a MacBook Pro to this one. I wanted one I could easily take to and from school, with a touch screen that also had great battery life. This one did great. The ONLY issue was about two months after I got it, it just didn't turn on one day. I called them and they had me send it in for repair. The repair was quick and they sent it right back. They paid for shipping, so it wasn't much of a hassle. It's a great computer. The battery lasts forever which is a major plus. It takes no time at all to start up. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie forbes

customer_reviews.title: Phantom Touch Issues - I do not recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Samsung Chromebook Pro Convertible in September 2017. It worked well for about 6 months and then we had "phantom touch" display screen problems. The screen would zoom in and out at random and the touch screen wouldn't work. We sent it in for warranty repairs in Apr 2018 and June 2018. It would work again for a short time and then go back to annoying phantom touch. I absolutely do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vishnu

customer_reviews.title: Barely out of warranty and broke
customer_reviews.text: Our computer is less than two years old and is bricked. My daughter was on a video conference when the screen went out and wouldn't turn on again. This is a common problem (Google "samsung chromebook blue light"). We called Samsung for help. We could tell that this was a common issue, they'd had a lot of practice with diagnosing the problem. They let us know that even though this is affecting lots of people, they would charge us for repairs because the laptop is out of warranty. We will not be buying any more Samsung Chromebooks and maybe no more Samsung devices.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Screen Flickering at random moments without even touching the device ...
customer_reviews.text: Screen Flickering at random moments without even touching the device? What is up with that Amazon! This is a buggy device and the issues with the random screen flickering is all over the web. Pull this item from your storefront and inform Samsung to fix their defective product!
customer_reviews.author: Bushmasterguy

customer_reviews.title: Super Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: What I love about this device: The screen. Its about the best screen on a laptop that I have used. Beautiful OLED screen. The speed. Faster then any chrome book I now. The size. Very thin and light. The battery. Love the fact I can charge for either side of the laptop. The pen. Yes it works great and is surprising useful. What I hate: (Hate is to strong of a word) Dislike? No lighted keyboard. Thats it. With the intro of Google Play Store and the ability to run Android apps, Chromebooks have become my thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Extremely User Unfriendly
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small lightweight laptop for my upcoming total knee replacement surgery. Samsung has a good reputation of having quality products. I downloaded several programs that I needed. NO ICON SHORTCUT was placed on the desktop for me to access my programs. The only way to get to the program you want is to go into the App Store where you originally downloaded the program from and from there you can open it. It is basically nothing more than an iPad or similar product you can watch movies or play games on.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J.

customer_reviews.title: Great! A few bugs
customer_reviews.text: I love this Chromebook. I use it for work and need to be mobile. It was hard for me to bite the bullet on such a high priced Chromebook, but has absolutely been worth it. It runs Android apps very well (some are horrible on a Chromebook) and handles multiple tabs very well. My only complaint is that it will freeze when I use a specific web app. It may be an issue with the website, but it's only freezing on this laptop. Hopefully future updates will help.
customer_reviews.author: smashton818

customer_reviews.title: What a dissapointment
customer_reviews.text: Samsung Chromebook - Top Quality - CNET Top rating - Arrives and keys on the keyboard do not work. Ugggh. Glad I opened it before Christmas to test and set up. Also glad Amazon has a fantastic return policy. Well done Amazon - Samsung? We expect better from a top tier name brand. I am actually glad is failed. I did more research and found the ASUS Chromebook Flip C302CA-DH54 12.5-inch on Amazon. Better bang for the buck, gorilla glass, better battery life and a bunch more accessories than the Samsung - like screen protector and hard plastic cases and more.
customer_reviews.author: gapcoffeeguy

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy and cheap !
customer_reviews.text: I am a writer of documents. Especially, I use Google 's document programs frequently. I did not like expensive appliances for office use. On a Chromebook, it's an expensive device, but it's a lot cheaper than other Windows laptops. I've been using my Chromebook for the first time, and I'm happy that it has a lot of boot speed, performance, connectivity to Android phones, and Chrome. Also, the fact that the pen is embedded in the laptop is very different from Apple's. Price configuration, device configuration is not worse than other devices.
customer_reviews.author: SBJ

customer_reviews.title: Hardware problems
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop, I have been using it for over a year now for college. However recently it started having problems, it moves on its own. I do not use it everyday, it has a hard case, tempered glass screen protector, a keyword cover and its clean, so I am sure it is not because it is damaged from a hit or dirt. It looks like a hardware problem, it get fix once I go from regular to tablet mode. Once it happens there is nothing I can do with it. There are many other people that reported similar problems, but since I got it so long ago there is nothing I can do now with the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco R.

customer_reviews.title: A solid chromebook
customer_reviews.text: It may take you awhile to get used to the slightly smaller than normal keyboard (and heaven help you if you move between kb sizes too), but that has been the only challenge is working with the device. It is light, portable, good battery life, and overall a step forward for those in the chrome/google/android/chromebook world. Now if only some key software makers (Quicken, TurboTax) would support a full function version for this niche... and if only the existing google spreadsheet scaled better (large sheets are unusable)... neither is the fault of the chromebook, but they are a blocker to getting rid of the LozeDoz box.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Software Developer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Chromebook Instead of a Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Recommend this over a tablet any day. Chrome OS has gotten a lot better since the Play Store was added. All of the Android apps I've used have ran flawless. Great design and decent battery life. If you just need a laptop/tablet for web browsing, office work, school, and medium work load this is great! The display is absolutely gorgeous and gets pretty bright. As long as you understand the limitations of a Chromebook then you should be set. However, it seems that list of limitations decrease each year.
customer_reviews.author: Tyronne Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Great work or personal use laptop! Lots of fun and great features!
customer_reviews.text: Really great product. Have not had any of the screen issues some reviewers talk about. The added digital pen feature is great! While it isn't quite as good as some ipad pros I've seen, it's pretty close and for almost half the price, well worth it! This gets used for both work and personal use and has done quite well in both roles. The tablet mode feature is very nice to use when wanted. Coming from a Toshiba Chromebook 2, it's nice having the Google Play store available with this laptop. While not all apps are ready to go for the Chromebook, the selection is still really nice and the apps generally work quite well.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY SAMSUNG CHROMEBOOK!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE MY SAMSUNG CHROMEBOOK! I am still learning all of the features and have become infatuated with the STYLUS features. I can upload a PDF or IMAGE then write, draw, color, sign, whatever and save to my device then upload or share it to whomever I wish. This is truly one of my best investments of 2018!
customer_reviews.author: Determined Mom

customer_reviews.title: Screen will react like its being touched when it is not
customer_reviews.text: Came with ghost touches. Screen will react like its being touched when it is not. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Much My Dream Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little machine for my uses. I've grown to like Chromebooks but wanted one with touchscreen. Love that this one folds over to tablet mode and can be tented as well, and the built-in stylus (clicks into its own integrated sheath on the right side of the case) makes keeping track of that little bugger almost a no-brainer. Haven't yet found apps for some of the things I want to be able to do, but so far I like it a lot. Four stars instead of five because a backlit keyboard would have been nice, but I guess if it was really important to me I'd have paid a higher price! Nice little machine at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: hyperhorny

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this Chromebook. It has been the most useful and convenient tool my clients have provided me with, and made it so much easier for me to tuck into work for a few hours at a time on my working vacations. When the battery dies, it's time of to go join the fun for a while! When I need to answer an email with detailed info, it is far easier to whip out my Chromebook than to mess with the small screen of my phone or lug out my laptop. Being able to snag apps from the Google store that mirror my phone apps is just icing on the cake!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough memory & crashes during updates
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, when annotating PDFs, the page closes and advises that my machine has run out of memory. Unfortunately, that is the least of the problems. After 50% of Chrome OS updates, system recovery is required to reboot. I am in the process for doing this a third time - unimpressed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Built The Way Laptops Should Have Originally Been Built
customer_reviews.text: Made of Quality Material CHECK Durable CHECK Cloud Storage CHECK Compatible With Google Play Store CHECK Comes with Own Stylus CHECK Converts to Tablet Mode CHECK Bluetooth Support CHECK Regular Updates CHECK Better Than Windows CHECK Doesn't Lag CHECK There isn't much this laptop can't do from my experience To me, it's the best of ALL the chromebooks.
customer_reviews.author: Hero Miles

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life, fast and responsive
customer_reviews.text: Fast product the laptop is extremely responsive. the touch screen seems responsive and accurately detects the placement of my finger or the pin. The screen brightness works well for me, currently this product does not support Linux apps if you were looking for that but it should be coming in time. The product is lightweight I connected a mouse via adapter and Bluetooth. I have found the sound acceptable this is mostly used for email and work purposes
customer_reviews.author: Walter G

customer_reviews.title: Wished the screen worked
customer_reviews.text: Have sent it back 3 times for repair of the screen. First 2 times for phantom touches on the screen making the device unusable the 3rd time the repaired device (new panel each time) touchscreen only worked with the pen .. could not be used with fingers. Waiting for the repaired unit again .. have lost 1 month of the 9 month that I owned the device for warranty work. When it works it is brilliant when it doesn't .... I am stuck without a machine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth frequently disables itself, rending mouse useless. Almost negates everything positive about this Chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely frustrating: Bluetooth randomly disables itself, like every 20 minutes, with two different mice. Lots of reports, many are experiencing this. And then you have to use the trackpad to go into settings, and re-enable Bluetooth. SUCKS!
customer_reviews.author: K Chieff

customer_reviews.title: Android tablet functionality not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is GREAT for the price. Feels way more substantial than my first generation Chromebook. I got the Chromebook Pro for the Android Tablet functionality and immediately started running into problems running some very common apps that run fine on ALL my other Android Tablets including a Samsung 12.2. I won't return it because as a Chromebook it's the cats meow, I'm just really disappointed in the Tablet functionality. I was hoping to study PADI materials on this tablet, but I'll have to continue using a PC for that. If you're looking for a very capable Chromebook, though, it's cool and having the stylus is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Browers

customer_reviews.title: Great simple laptop perfect for web browsing and simple games
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop because I wanted to try something other than a Windows product. The Chromebook software is intuitive if you've used any Android phone you can find anything you need on this device. I enjoy using it and it seems to have a very bad connection even though I have slower Wi-Fi. I have been recommending it to other people who want an inexpensive way to keep track of information online
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Smith

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love.
customer_reviews.text: This machine has impressed me so far. The Android apps that you can run on this machine has been wonderful. The machine itself has a nice solid feel about it and even though the keyboard isn't lighted, I have had no problem with it. I was seriously considering the Pixel book but for a lot less, you practically have the same experience. I highly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Foster

customer_reviews.title: I have really enjoyed this Chromebook so far
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this Chromebook so far. I can't think of any complaints so far. Screen is great and the only downside that I can think of is the speakers. Since they are on the bottom, they are drowned out pretty easily. The track pad is quite stiff and it is hard to get it to click at times. Other than these small things, performance wise it is performing very well.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: cool but I returned it
customer_reviews.text: I experimented with this chromebook for about 30 days. Web browsing was great but it's not really suited for anything else. It doesn't have USB or any other ports for that matter, plus chromebooks don't have a CAPS LOCK button or DELETE button (wtf?). I almost kept it but I ended up returning it and going back to a Windows operating system.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Weak Pen
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this tablet. This is a high end Chromebook, and while that sounds a bit odd, once someone starts using it, they say the same. Solid construction with a beautiful screen. The only downside, through a field of positives, is that the pen included is incredibly fragile. This particular model does have replacements one can buy from Samsung, but they will not match the original. Overall, unless you plan to do a lot, you'll be fine with the Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Era

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: 3 YEAR UPDATE: My Chromebook is now developing Ghost/Phantom touches and though I've tried to get it repaired (through a shop or by myself) it seems like I'd have to replace the whole screen (-$300). Considering how the Chromebook itself was only $499, I'm using this opportunity to look into other laptops. I'm deeply saddened that I'll have to part with this machine, it really has been wonderful. If the warranty was still in order, I would've returned it and gotten a new one but I can't. Samsung, if you're reading this, HMU if you're feeling generous.
customer_reviews.author: Sitrus

customer_reviews.title: This machine is absolutely fantastic. It is fast and I love that it ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine is absolutely fantastic. It is fast and I love that it can run all of my Play Store apps. I have not had locking up issues, and this is the best Chromebook I have used so far. There is really noting I can complain about with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Hoovie

customer_reviews.title: Better than apple anything
customer_reviews.text: This is my first chromebook. I use it more than i used my laptop. I was not raised around computers and am more familier with smart phones. Since chromebooks are app based and now have google play its perfect. The only downfall is not having microsoft office but google docs works the same i just have to get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: mark anthony hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Wack durability!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working right after the 1 year warranty expired. It was just fine the day before. Seems sus. Tho for the one year I had it. Absolutely amazing 😔. Repair cost almost the same as what I bought it for. So R.I.P
customer_reviews.author: misael guzman

customer_reviews.title: Homerun! Bang for your Buck Computer
customer_reviews.text: Its a great computer! period. I use the stylus to edit documents and the touch screen is responsive. The keyboard feels great under my hands. Tablet mode is comfortable and purposeful. I cannot recommend more. Its almost as good as and IPAD Pro except for the Ipad pencil being a little better. Im on team chromebook and this computer swung me.
customer_reviews.author: confetti_yeti

customer_reviews.title: Best Chromebook / Notebook ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Chromebook I ever head. Screen is fantastic as is battery life. Installed one Android app which works just fine as well. Used to be an Apple fanboy. I bought the first Chromebook in 2014 (just for fun) and haven't used anything else ever since. Just perfect for web, spreadsheets, word docs, Youtube. Everything I use a computer for. No trouble ever with updating or installing any software. Chromebooks just work.
customer_reviews.author: Hollister

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a Chromebook with a good display, a fast processor, and was lightweight. That's exactly what I got! The USB type C is new to me, so I also purchased a couple adapters just in case, but haven't needed to use them yet. Being able to charge the device from either side is very handy. The battery life is strong from my basic use. The speakers aren't the best, but I wasn't looking for something with great speakers. The stylus is actually one of the best I've used! I don't use it often, but when I do, it is very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Will B

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For someone who needs just wants to have internet access, email, and write the occasional document, this little laptop is more than adequate. I don't game or photo edit or anything requiring use of complex apps. The price was great and it took less than 5 minutes to set up. It fits my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: bkerschner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent device. Light and powerful with plenty of battery life. No issues with android apps so far. Pen input is still crappy when using Google Keep, but is fantastic with Android app Squid. No mysterious crashes as mentioned in a review on The Verge.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Luria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent screen and overall Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: So this is my second Samsung, I had to return the first one due to a mini defect. This one is perfect. It runs smoothly with Android Apps, the touch screen is great, and the screen in general is AMAZING. I've had chromebooks for the last 4 + years and this by far is the best one ive ever purchased. They are getting better and better by the year.
customer_reviews.author: James Scott Jr

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for 3 months then NOT!
customer_reviews.text: This netbook worked well for the first 3 months and then the screen lost touch sensitivity. Now it only works with the stylus. I tried to reset it using some instructions on forums by turning off and then back on with refresh key + on button. It didn't help screen sensitivity - it still doesn't react to touch except with stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: What is an Administrator? WHO WHERE, can't sign on have a Chromebook (3) and won't allow for
customer_reviews.text: Amazon and llc co. won't let you talk to anyone it's either return or keep SUCH A NICE PIECE of equip must be stolen or from school or something WON'T LET US USE!! Nice job on the recondition, but DIDN'T REMOVE THE ADMIN from letting us use it! WE CAN'T AND NO ONE NO ONE EVER GOT BACK TO US! We didn't want to return it's been COVID 19 almost 45 days now
customer_reviews.author: David Howard

customer_reviews.title: First time chromebook user
customer_reviews.text: The device arrived two days after ordering with no packaging deficits. Setup was easy, so far I am pleased with the display and the sound. I can easily bluetooth to a speaker for improved sound, the keyboard feels cramped but is has a good feel. It is so easy to convert from tablet to laptop and the feel is slender and not bulky. I'm not a tech person but I am very pleased with this device so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mary franczak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect except for the keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to return it because of the cramped keyboard design and poor typing feel, and then the trackpad started acting like a ghostly hand was moving things around the screen, so I was forced to return it. But otherwise it's a remarkable little machine that works extremely well. The screen is gorgeous and the pen is a great convenience (though it lags tremendously slowly).
customer_reviews.author: L. Busch

customer_reviews.title: Super Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: This Samsung Chromebook is great!. Love the keyboard (just wish it was backlit). Turns on quickly. This is the first time I chose a computer with a stylus and it was definitely worth it. I can easily write and draw. The screen is excellent too. Overall, its one of the best computers I've ever had. Very satisfied indeed. Beach Camera (the supplier) was awesome. I had the Chromebook in less than 2 days!
customer_reviews.author: Cal Croucher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chromebook with an amazing display. I had purchased the Plus model and wasn't happy with the speed of the processer, so I returned it for the pro model. All I can say is that it is definitely worth the price difference. Much snappier and quicker than the plus model.
customer_reviews.author: glj104

customer_reviews.title: Overall great, but has a few issues
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is great but I had an issue with the stylus coming apart. This happened on the first day I got it. I ended up havin to super glue the two pieces together. Another thing I've noticed is that if headphones are in for too long, the jack will get hot and stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy!
customer_reviews.text: Stylus stopped working inside of two weeks. Touch screen glitches. Touch screen keyboard pops up on the screen without being launched. Screen resized on it own repeatedly while moving thru internet pages. Reset twice now with no result. Relaxed a $150 chrome book that was more reliable. Disappointed. Should have stuck with throw away chrome books and Apple products. My fault for venturing mid market.
customer_reviews.author: KCASEY

customer_reviews.title: So far so good from a confirmed pc user
customer_reviews.text: So far so good from a confirmed pc user. No issues after one week. Travel extensively and last pc from lenovo (Miix 700) had a failure and would not boot, so gave this a try. cheaper than lenovo and hope will last longer. adjusted to keyboard in 10 minutes. screen is great. no issues and speakers are fine for what it is. Office doc. do get weird going from docx to gdoc but my documents most times exceed 2mb. Will update in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Walters

customer_reviews.title: Would buy 100 more.
customer_reviews.text: Took advice from a very techy friend as an alternative to an expensive laptop or MacBook Pro. I couldn’t be more happy or more impressed with this chromebook. I do everything from artwork with the amazing touch screen, to keeping books for my business. All while switching from Netflix to checking delivery’s from Amazon. All lightning fast because there’s no massive operating system bogging everything down. Really ask yourself why you need a laptop in the first place..... I think you’re find this is plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: I like it ..
customer_reviews.text: I did have to send the Chromebook to Samsung 3 times though. The screen would flash, and the mouse pointer would go all over the place without me touching anything. After the 3rd time getting it back it finally is working correctly. I do truly like it though
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Not a wise choice
customer_reviews.text: I think this computer is overpriced for its capabilities. It's fine as a second computer but not adequate for a main.
customer_reviews.author: jacquie

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I had doubts spending 500 on a Chromebook book but Amazon's 6 month 0% payment is to good to pass up. This is a sleek, responsive, hybrid that is ideal for students, non-gamers, home , and business. The app store has everything plus to make this a great buy for anyone. I'm running 5 ebusinesses with this chromebook and I am amazed how light and thin it is, really bravo on this baby, it's my money machine.
customer_reviews.author: TigerBloodTony

customer_reviews.title: Quite pleased
customer_reviews.text: this is exactly what I was expecting it to be. It also shipped quickly. The shipping box was banged up a bit but the product box within was in perfect shape and the product was untouched.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product! I bought this as birhtday gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! I bought this as birhtday gift for my 13 year old as she was always taking my Mac for her stuff. I did not wanted to spend as much for another mac. She loves it. its battry is great too. you won't need high end computer if you are not playing graphic intense game or applications or developing some software with meomory heavy tools. This one is perfect for computer educated kids.
customer_reviews.author: Prashant Deshmukh

customer_reviews.title: Great for school, Play Store is debatable
customer_reviews.text: After a brutal wait time for the laptop to update its software and apps, it works great for college related stuff. Though don't expect too much from the integrated Play Store since it's still in beta. I tried apps like Clash Royale and Vainglory yet the screen would sometimes freeze for a second which is pretty annoying regardless if you have a great internet connection. Though apps for media/videos should do just fine. S pen is a little cherry on top but after clicking it so many times, the top of the pen sprung out so had to glue thing together.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box I had keyboard issues. Keys sticking and not responding. Unclear on how to return. Update: They did ship a replacement, so changing the rating a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob D

customer_reviews.title: Buy this laptop instead of spending $1500 to browse YouTube and Facebook
customer_reviews.text: Love this laptop but as with any Chromebook, you need to know its limitations. As a software engineer, I know that I'm not going to be running an IDEs on this thing. But it handles all my recreational uses just fine. I use apps like WeVideo to edit my drone videos in 4K and the fact that it runs Android apps fills almost every gap you'd have between a traditional PC.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Pretty flimsy laptop with no backlit keyboard. Stylus works fine and writing on it is easy, but battery time is sorely disappointing. I took the risk reading the reviews that this laptop died and gives users a pink light of death from the power button and becomes inoperable, and that's exactly what happened after 1 year of owning it. Not worth the money...
customer_reviews.author: Belal

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and features of this laptop. It has met every expectation and more. The versatility that ChromeOs and Android provides is superior to iOS, MacOS and WindowsOS for the way I work since an Android phone has been my primary persobal computer for years now. A backlit keyboard is the only thing I would change.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Its like a tablet you can download apps off of Google play. It's very efficient in turns on very fast. The battery charge last me couple days. The only downfall is you Cant put anything on the front screen and customize it the way you would like! Other then that in very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Minanim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little machine
customer_reviews.text: I use it with the screen standing up to watch videos and movies. It is perfect. But, I can do most anything I use my on my 24 inch all in one, except run photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Kehoe

customer_reviews.title: Software problems
customer_reviews.text: Its very very nice hardware but there is a software problem that open and closes random windows/ apps all the time - very difficult and annoying to work when its going crazy I restart it many times.. I tryed to contact samsung but no reply ...
customer_reviews.author: alon lahack

customer_reviews.title: 2nd best Chromebook made (see
customer_reviews.text: 2nd best Chromebook made (see: Pixelbook). Kind of wish it could run Android apps a little better at full resolution, but it's not really meant for that.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSnake

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in one week
customer_reviews.text: The backspace key stopped working after just one week. Craziest thing.... this is a Chromebook and I used to use a MacBook to chromecast shows to my tv. How is it the MacBook casts a google product better than a Chromebook built in the google os? Even an iPad Pro is better to use Google Chromecast than a Chromebook. That makes no sense. I wonder which keys would stop working next week if I kept it another week. Never been so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barth

customer_reviews.title: Learn all the hotkeys and tricks to maximize functionality
customer_reviews.text: Very fast on start and reset. Large variety of apps exclusive to Chromebook although you'll find a lot of them want you to pay in some sort or another. Not a big game player but I did use an Emulator for Roms and had Zero problems connecting my Playstation 4 controller through bluetooth without any apps. The drawing app is decently accurate once you get used to it, it's for sure not paper. Chrome is very fast, as well as the product itself. Glad I got this at the pre-order price. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erin L. Shaughnessy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support many Samsung apps
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm just an idiot, but I bought this tablet because I wanted to use all the same apps I use on my Note+. However, many of the Samsung apps do not work (won't even download) on this tablet. Disappointing. Great tablet otherwise: touch screen, resolution, speed, physical appearance and functionality - all great. But due to incompatibility, 3 stars at best.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Great when I used it 5 times this month... then it died.
customer_reviews.text: Used it 5 times... tonight it crashed and started a reboot sequence which ended it up with the screen going black. Then the only thing would work was the power light. Tried numerous times to do a recovery, but the screen would come on sporadically and appear digitized with missing bits (Video card issue). Recovery window came up twice then the screen went black again. Tried for two hours to get it to turn on again and then gave up and asked for a refund. Samsung's hardware issues are apparently not limited to their phones.
customer_reviews.author: North of the Stream

customer_reviews.title: One way camera
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the fact that it had a front facing camera. I bought this for my page turner, but I couldn't take pics of my music sheets. The camera info wasn't in the description.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bonus

customer_reviews.title: Love my chromebook!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love how light weight it is and it's very fast I'm able to do lot with it. Battery doesnt last as long as I would like it to last but otherwise I have nothing to complain about it
customer_reviews.author: linlin

customer_reviews.title: ELEGANT AND NEXT LEVEL CHROMEBOOK
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Beautiful. Amazing screen. Perfect size. Pen with squid is best in class. USB C for easy charging. I love the keyboard. Can type hella fast. I'm a nut for Chromebooks. I love my Acer R11. I think of that one as my Subaru WRX. And my rugged Asus C202 is my Jeep. But this baby is my 911 Targa. Wow. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my daughter....
customer_reviews.text: Super great for school work, browsing... just an all around great little tool. Battery life is surprisingly long lasting for such a small until. Last Chromebook we had for her was an HP, which was ok for the time we had it... but this things build quality is much better.... owned for a year now... no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tammera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Chromebook. Used for 1 year and still great. The keyboard is a bit small for people that like to type a lot or have larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Nanna loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Mother-in-law needs the good resolution to see the screen. Works great for her. Simple to use, storage in the cloud. Is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Caster

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to any college student or lightweight computer enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: This computer has replaced my daily laptop (2014 MacBook Pro) in every way. It is lightweight, FAST, simple, and an overall extremely enjoyable experience to use. I have been using it in developer mode so I can do most of my python development (installed conda and run notebooks as needed). The only thing I've used my Mac for since getting this is to run Windows. Highly recommend to any college student or lightweight computer enthusiast!
customer_reviews.author: Evan G.

customer_reviews.title: I got this as my daughter’s 8th grade graduation gift ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as my daughter’s 8th grade graduation gift. She loves it. She likes it more than a Mac Air (and only half the price!) because it’s got a pressure sensitive screen so she can sketch, draw, paint and do graphic design. Plus there are so many apps for school and hobbies.
customer_reviews.author: mamabear88

customer_reviews.title: ... the Pro for about a month now and I love it! It does every I expected it would ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Pro for about a month now and I love it! It does every I expected it would and more. I had no overheating problem as some have told us to expect. I have worked it long and hard and it has never overheated or displayed any other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D.

customer_reviews.title: If you buy this, save the box so you can ship it back when it breaks. Twice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these. It worked fairly well for about 10 months. Then the stylus functionality stopped working with the touch screen. It was under warranty, so Samsung told me to ship it to them to get it fixed. When they shipped it back a couple weeks later, it worked for about a day before it stopped working again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement Chromebook. Was happy with my old one, but dropped it and it became unreliable. The old manufacturer stopped making computers. This unit is quicker than my old one. It has longer battery life. screen display is clear and crisp. backspace key is too small, but I have adjusted. This is a very good machine if you are a Chromebook user and need portability

customer_reviews.title: Fragile

I know the battery life isn't that long but I am not a traveler so it's not an issue for me. Would I prefer a faster processor and more Ram yep, but not a deal breaker for my use.

customer_reviews.text: I've had it less than 60 days and it has already stopped charging. Not worth it. Never dropped it or left it in the car so I can't explain why it broke except manufacturing error or poor quality.

customer_reviews.title: would be an absolutely fantastic chromebook if the touch screen would work for my ...
customer_reviews.text: would be an absolutely fantastic chromebook if the touch screen would work for my hands, only the stylus works on it for me. Still does what I need it to for school though.

customer_reviews.text: I love this. Seriously, better than laptop. Charges easy. Love the touch screen.

customer_reviews.text: This is my first Chromebook purchase. I had low expectations of what Chromebooks can do, or how I was going to use them. Some people complained about the keyboard, but for me, it is perfectly fine.
